visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly sales trends across two regions using synthetic time-series data with seasonal patterns
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two temporal series (μ_North=214.3, σ=27.8; μ_South=235.4, σ=33.6) representing monthly sales figures. Synthetic data was generated with opposing seasonal trends: Northern sales peak in summer (June-July) while Southern sales peak in fall (September-October), maintaining realistic financial ranges and 12-month cyclicality. The spline chart was chosen to emphasize smooth trend progression between discrete monthly measurements, optimizing Tufte's data-ink ratio by removing chart borders while retaining essential gridlines. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through distinct hue differentiation (sea green vs steel blue) and direct value labeling. Marker visibility balances clutter reduction with precise value location, and the dual-peak pattern demonstrates intentional temporal phase opposition in synthetic data generation.
